Title: Liver : The gut is a key target of therapy in hepatic encephalopathy
Abstract: © 2015 Macmillan Publishers Limited.Little progress has been made in the pharmacological management of patients with hepatic encephalopathy, partly because it is difficult to perform clinical trials in this group of patients. A new clinical trial now suggests that polyethylene glycol is more effective than the current standard first-line therapy in these patients.
